description: Before/after transformations showing how to reframe common OKR anti-patterns

examples.context: Product development team focusing on feature delivery

key_results: Launch 3 new features
Fix 50 bugs
Improve code quality
problems: Focuses on outputs (features) rather than outcomes (user value)

after.objective: Increase user engagement through valuable feature experiences
key_results: Achieve 60% adoption rate for new collaborative editing feature within 30 days
Reduce user-reported critical issues from 12/month to <3/month
Increase user session duration from 8 to 12 minutes average

questions: What user outcome will these features create?
How will users behave differently when we succeed?
What business metric will improve as a result?
reframing_technique.explanation: By asking 'why' we want to build features, we uncover the real user outcomes we're trying to drive. This shifts focus from delivery to impact.

examples.context: Sales team focusing on hiring and activities

key_results: Hire 5 new sales reps
Conduct 100 sales training sessions
Implement new CRM system

after.objective: Accelerate revenue growth through improved sales execution
key_results: Increase monthly recurring revenue from $500K to $750K
Improve average deal size from $25K to $40K
Achieve 35% win rate on qualified opportunities (from current 22%)

questions: What revenue outcome are we trying to achieve?
How will we measure sales team effectiveness?
What customer behavior changes indicate success?
reframing_technique.explanation: Reframe hiring and training as means to an end. The real objective is revenue growth and sales effectiveness.

examples.context: Marketing team focusing on awareness metrics

key_results: Get 50K social media followers
Achieve 100K website visits per month
Reach 25% brand awareness in target market
problems: Vanity metrics that don't drive business value

after.objective: Drive qualified lead generation through strategic brand building
key_results: Generate 500 marketing qualified leads per month (from current 180)
Achieve 15% lead-to-customer conversion rate (from current 8%)
Increase organic search traffic to 40K monthly visits with 3% conversion
improvements: Lead generation as primary business outcome

questions: What business action should awareness drive?
How do we measure interest becoming intent?
What conversion metrics matter most for growth?
reframing_technique.explanation: Transform awareness metrics into business value metrics. Focus on the customer journey from awareness to action.

examples.context: Content team focusing on engagement metrics

key_results: Achieve 1M content views per month
Get 10K social media shares
Reach 500K content impressions

after.objective: Drive customer acquisition through valuable content experiences
key_results: Generate 300 content-driven leads per month with 20% sales qualification rate
Achieve 25% email signup rate from blog content (from current 12%)
Increase content-to-trial conversion rate from 3% to 8%
improvements: Trial conversion connecting content to product

questions: What action should content inspire?
How does content quality translate to business value?
What conversion metrics show content effectiveness?
reframing_technique.explanation: Reframe content success from consumption to conversion. Measure how content drives the customer journey forward.

examples.context: Customer success team with improvement goal

key_results: Make customers happier
Reduce customer complaints
Increase customer satisfaction
problems: No specific measurement of happiness or satisfaction
Relative terms without baselines or targets

after.objective: Maximize customer lifetime value through exceptional experience delivery
key_results: Increase Net Promoter Score from 32 to 55
Reduce customer churn rate from 8% to 5% monthly
Achieve 90% first-call resolution rate (from current 67%)

questions: How do we measure customer happiness objectively?
What behavior change indicates better experience?
Which metrics predict customer lifetime value?
reframing_technique.explanation: Transform subjective experience goals into measurable customer behavior and standardized satisfaction metrics.

key_results: Make processes faster
Reduce operational costs
Improve team productivity

after.objective: Achieve operational excellence through measurable efficiency gains
key_results: Reduce order fulfillment time from 3 days to 24 hours
Decrease operational cost per unit from $12 to $8.50
Increase team output from 150 to 220 units per person per day
improvements: Specific timing improvements with clear targets
Unit cost reduction with precise measurement
Productivity measured in concrete output terms

questions: What specific process timing can we measure?
How do we calculate cost per unit of output?
What concrete productivity metrics matter most?
reframing_technique.explanation: Convert efficiency concepts into specific, measurable operational metrics with clear baselines and targets.

key_results: Complete SOC 2 audit successfully
Pass security assessment
Obtain ISO 27001 certification
problems: Binary success/failure without measurement of excellence
Pass/fail thinking without degrees of success

after.objective: Establish security excellence through comprehensive compliance achievement
key_results: Achieve SOC 2 Type II certification within 6 months with zero audit findings
Complete security assessment with 95%+ score and remediate all critical items within 30 days
Obtain ISO 27001 certification while reducing compliance overhead from 40 to 20 hours/month

questions: How can we measure degrees of success beyond pass/fail?
What timeline would demonstrate organizational capability?
How can we achieve compliance efficiently?
reframing_technique.explanation: Add measurement dimensions to binary goals: timeline, quality score, efficiency, and process improvement.

examples.context: Leadership team with broad transformation goal

before.objective: Transform the business through growth, efficiency, and innovation
key_results: Increase revenue and reduce costs and improve products
Expand internationally while optimizing operations and enhancing culture
Launch new services and upgrade technology and develop talent
problems: Too many unrelated outcomes in single objective

after.objective: Drive sustainable growth through operational excellence
key_results: Increase revenue from $10M to $15M while maintaining 25%+ gross margin
Reduce operational cost per customer from $45 to $30 through automation
Achieve 95% customer satisfaction score while expanding to 2 new markets
improvements: Related metrics that reinforce each other

questions: What's the one most important outcome we need to achieve?
How do these different goals support each other?
What would focus look like for this objective?
reframing_technique.explanation: Choose one primary theme and ensure all key results support that central outcome. Remove unrelated elements.
